PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Supreme safety film
CatDescriptText: Related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 16, 1941, pg. 2, reads: "Buddy, Rochester are Pals - Perhaps the proudest youngster in East End this morning is Phidias (Buddy) Chronis, 7-year-old son of Mr. and Mrs. George Chronis of Frankstown avenue. The talented youngster is one of the Pittsburgh 'pals' of Eddie 'Rochester' Anderson, famous radio and screen luminary.  The above picture was snapped to during the film star's recent engagement at Pittsburgh's Stanley Theatre. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Eddie "Rochester" Anderson holding boater hat, wearing towel around neck, and cigar in mouth, posed squatting with Phidias "Buddy" Chronis, at Stanley Theatre
